whatIsIt.title: What are Highlights?
whatIsIt.description: Highlights let you select specific moments from a meeting transcript and combine them into a shareable video clip. You can add captions, speaker overlays, and choose between landscape or portrait formats for social media.

workflow.title: Basic Workflow
workflow.step1: Create a new highlight using the button in the header or from the highlights list
workflow.step2: Click on utterances (or Click and Shift+Click for ranges) in the transcript to add or remove them from your highlight
workflow.step3: Use Preview to review your selection and configure video generation options
workflow.step4: Generate your video and share it

creationMethods.title: Ways to Create a Highlight
creationMethods.headerButton: Click the 'Create Highlight' button in the meeting header
creationMethods.contextMenu: Right-click any utterance and select 'Start Highlight from here'
creationMethods.listButton: Click '+ Add Highlight' in the highlights list

navigation.title: Navigating Clips
navigation.subtitle: These options are available on the timeline

saving.title: Saving Changes
saving.subtitle: These options are available in the mode bar

openPreview.question: How do I preview my highlight?
openPreview.answer: Click the 'Preview' button in the mode bar. This opens a dialog where you can watch your selected clips play through in sequence and see a text preview of the content.

aspectRatio.question: What video formats are available?
aspectRatio.answer: Choose between Default (16:9) for standard landscape video, or Social Media (9:16) for portrait format optimized for TikTok, Instagram Stories, and YouTube Shorts.

contentOptions.question: What content options can I configure?
contentOptions.answer: You can enable Captions (text overlay of spoken content) and Speaker Overlays (visual identification of who is speaking during their segments). Note: These options are only visible in the final generated video, not in the preview.

generate.question: How do I generate the video?
generate.answer: Click 'Generate Video' in the preview dialog. The system will auto-save your changes, then create the video. You'll receive an email when it's ready, or you can track progress on the highlight's page.

editDetails.question: How do I change the highlight name or connect a subject?
editDetails.answer: Click the edit icon next to the highlight name in the mode bar. This opens a dialog where you can update the name and optionally connect the highlight to a meeting subject for better organization.

selected.title: Selected Utterances
selected.description: Utterances included in your highlight are shown with bold text and an underline. Click them again to remove them from the highlight.

timeline.title: Timeline Overlay
timeline.description: Selected clips appear as amber bars on the timeline above the video player. Click these bars to navigate directly to that clip in the video.

unsaved.title: Unsaved Changes Indicator
unsaved.description: A small red dot appears next to the highlight name when you have unsaved changes. Use Save from the dropdown menu to persist your changes.

modeBar.title: Mode Bar
modeBar.description: The amber bar at the top indicates you're in highlight editing mode. It shows real-time statistics (duration, speaker count, utterance count) and provides access to all editing controls.
